stages.title: Growth Stages Guide
stages.selectCrop: Select a crop to view stages

stage1.title: Land Preparation
stage1.overview: Land preparation involves clearing, ploughing, puddling, leveling, and building infrastructure to create optimal conditions for rice cultivation.

clearField.title: Clear the Field
clearField.description: Remove all weeds, previous crop residues, and stones to prevent pests and diseases and ensure a uniform seedbed.

ploughing.title: Ploughing
ploughing.description: Plough 2‚Äì3 times to a depth of 10 cm to loosen the soil, improve aeration, and mix in organic matter.

flooding.title: Flooding and Puddling
flooding.description: Flood the field and churn into a muddy bed to suppress weeds and retain water.

leveling.title: Leveling
leveling.description: Level the field to ensure even water distribution, preventing dry patches and waterlogging.

bunds.title: Bund Construction
bunds.description: Build raised borders around the field to retain irrigation water.

channels.title: Field Channels
channels.description: Create channels for efficient irrigation and drainage throughout the crop cycle.

stage2.title: Seed Selection and Preparation
stage2.overview: For a healthy crop, it is crucial to start with high-quality seeds. Use certified Telangana Sona (RNR 15048) seeds that are mature, clean, and have a high germination rate.

selectSeeds.title: Select Quality Seeds
selectSeeds.description: Choose certified seeds with high germination rate to ensure varietal purity and strong growth.

treatment.title: Seed Treatment
treatment.description: Soak seeds for 24 hours, incubate for 24‚Äì36 hours until sprouting, treat with fungicide (carbendazim 2g/kg).

nursery.title: Nursery Bed Preparation
nursery.description: Set up raised beds with farmyard manure and zinc sulphate, sow sprouted seeds evenly.

stage3.title: Sowing and Transplanting
stage3.overview: Transplanting is performed using healthy seedlings that are 21‚Äì25 days old, as younger seedlings establish quickly and yield better.

seedlingAge.title: Seedling Age
seedlingAge.description: Use 21‚Äì25 day old seedlings for better establishment and yield.

spacing.title: Spacing
spacing.description: Maintain 20 x 20 cm spacing for good sunlight, airflow, and nutrient access.

depth.title: Planting Depth
depth.description: Plant at 5 cm depth to promote root development.

water.title: Water Management
water.description: Maintain 5 cm water layer after transplanting to minimize shock.

stage4.title: Fertilizer and Nutrient Management
stage4.overview: Fertility management starts by applying organic manure during land preparation, followed by balanced application of major nutrients.

npk.title: NPK Application
npk.description: Apply 100‚Äì120 kg/ha Nitrogen, 60 kg/ha Phosphorus, 50 kg/ha Potassium.

splitApplication.title: Split Application
splitApplication.description: Split nitrogen and potassium into 2‚Äì3 applications during growth stages.

micronutrients.title: Micronutrients
micronutrients.description: Apply zinc sulphate (25 kg/ha) if deficiency appears.

stage5.title: Water Management
stage5.overview: Rice requires consistent water throughout its growth. Maintain proper water levels and practice efficient irrigation methods.

waterDepth.title: Water Depth
waterDepth.description: Maintain 5‚Äì7 cm water during tillering and flowering.

awd.title: Alternate Wetting and Drying
awd.description: Allow soil to dry between irrigations in water-limited areas.

drainage.title: Pre-harvest Drainage
drainage.description: Remove water 7‚Äì10 days before harvest for easier operations.

stage6.title: Weed, Pest, and Disease Management
stage6.overview: Control weeds through manual or mechanical methods, and monitor for pests and diseases regularly.

weedControl.title: Weed Control
weedControl.description: Perform manual/mechanical weeding 20‚Äì30 days after transplanting.

chemical.title: Chemical Control
chemical.description: Use appropriate herbicides like Pendimethalin or Pyrazosulfuron-ethyl.

pestMonitoring.title: Pest Monitoring
pestMonitoring.description: Monitor for pests and apply controls based on expert advice.

stage7.title: Harvesting
stage7.overview: Rice is ready for harvest around 120‚Äì125 days after sowing when grains turn golden yellow and hard.

timing.title: Harvest Timing
timing.description: Harvest when grains are golden yellow and hard (120‚Äì125 days after sowing).

method.title: Harvest Method
method.description: Use sickle for manual or harvester for large-scale operations.

drying.title: Field Drying
drying.description: Stack cut bundles upright for 1-2 days for further drying.

stage8.title: Post-Harvest Operations
stage8.overview: Process and store harvested grain properly to maintain quality and prevent losses.

threshing.title: Threshing
threshing.description: Thresh grains using manual methods or mechanical thresher.

cleaning.title: Cleaning
cleaning.description: Remove debris through winnowing and sieving.

drying.title: Drying
drying.description: Dry grains to 14% moisture content for safe storage.

storage.title: Storage
storage.description: Store in clean, dry containers with proper pest control measures.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Farmacy App - Agricultural Support Platform
terms.section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
terms.section1.body1: By accessing or using the Farmacy App, you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, you may not access or use the app. By accessing, downloading, installing, or using the Farmacy App, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service, along with our Privacy Policy.
terms.section1.body2: If you are using the app on behalf of another person or organization, you affirm that you are authorized to accept these terms on their behalf. Your continued use of the App after any changes to the Terms will be considered upon your acceptance of those changes.
terms.section2.title: 2. Description of Services
terms.section2.body1: The Farmacy App is a digital mobile application designed to provide AI-driven and data-supported agricultural solutions to farmers, agricultural professionals, and related stakeholders.
terms.section2.subSection1.title: 2.1. AI-Based Crop Diagnosis
terms.section2.subSection1.body: Users can upload images of their crops to detect diseases or disorders using artificial intelligence models, with accuracy scores and recommended treatments.
terms.section2.subSection2.title: 2.2. Weather Monitoring & Alerts
terms.section2.subSection2.body: Real-time and forecast-based weather data with personalized agricultural recommendations based on climate conditions.
terms.section2.subSection3.title: 2.3. Educational Content
terms.section2.subSection3.body: Daily farming tips, stage-wise crop care guidance, and audio-visual learning modules in local languages.
terms.section3.title: 3. User Accounts
terms.section3.body1: To access certain features, users may be required to create a personal account. You are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.
terms.section3.subSection1.title: 3.1. Account Registration
terms.section3.subSection1.body: Registration may require: Full name, contact information, location, and preferred language. You agree to provide accurate and current information.
terms.section3.subSection2.title: 3.2. Account Security
terms.section3.subSection2.body: You must notify us immediately if you suspect unauthorized access and not share your account credentials with others.
terms.section4.title: 4. User Responsibilities
terms.section4.body1: You agree to use the platform responsibly, ethically, and in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.
terms.section4.subSection1.title: 4.1. Compliance with Laws
terms.section4.subSection1.body: You agree not to use the app in any way that violates local, national, or international laws or regulations.
terms.section4.subSection2.title: 4.2. Use of AI Features
terms.section4.subSection2.body: When using image-based crop diagnosis, only upload real and relevant images. AI results are advisory and may not replace expert agricultural consultation.
terms.section5.title: 5. Intellectual Property
terms.section5.body1: All content, technology, and services provided through the Farmacy App are the exclusive property of Farmacy or its authorized licensors. This includes app design, software code, AI models, visual elements, and educational content.
terms.section5.subSection1.title: 5.1. User Content
terms.section5.subSection1.body: You retain ownership of content you upload but grant Farmacy a license to use it for delivering app services and improving AI models in anonymized form.
terms.section6.title: 6. Data Usage & Privacy
terms.section6.body1: We collect personal information, agricultural data, usage data, and location data to provide and improve our services. Your data is securely stored using industry-standard protocols.
terms.section6.subSection1.title: 6.1. Data Security
terms.section6.subSection1.body: All data transfers use SSL encryption and access is restricted to authorized personnel only.
terms.section6.subSection2.title: 6.2. User Control
terms.section6.subSection2.body: You can update your profile, withdraw consent, or request account deletion at any time.
terms.section7.title: 7. Third-Party Services
terms.section7.body1: The app integrates with weather APIs, AI tools, cloud services, and analytics platforms. While we work with trusted partners, we are not responsible for errors or security practices of third-party platforms.
terms.section8.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
terms.section8.body1: Farmacy App shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, or consequential damages resulting from your use of the application. All services are provided 'as is' without warranties.
terms.section8.subSection1.title: 8.1. No Professional Advice
terms.section8.subSection1.body: AI-based diagnosis and suggestions are not a substitute for expert consultation. Consult qualified agronomists before making critical farming decisions.
terms.section9.title: 9. Termination
terms.section9.body1: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your access for conduct that violates these Terms or is deemed harmful to the platform. You may also terminate your account at any time.
terms.section10.title: 10. Changes to the Terms
terms.section10.body1: We reserve the right to update these Terms at any time. Material changes will be communicated via in-app message or notification. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of revised Terms.
terms.footer.contact: For questions about these Terms, please contact our support team through the app.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Farmacy App - Agricultural Support Platform
privacy.section1.title: 1. Introduction
privacy.section1.body: This Privacy Policy explains how Farmacy collects, uses, and protects your information when you use our app. By using Farmacy, you consent to the practices described in this policy.
privacy.section2.title: 2. Information We Collect
privacy.section2.subSection1.title: 2.1. Personal Information
privacy.section2.subSection1.body: We may collect personal details such as your name, phone number, location, and language preferences when you register or use certain features.
privacy.section2.subSection2.title: 2.2. Agricultural & Usage Data
privacy.section2.subSection2.body: We collect data about your crops, farming activities, and app usage to provide personalized recommendations and improve our services.
privacy.section2.subSection3.title: 2.3. Device & Log Information
privacy.section2.subSection3.body: We may collect device information (model, OS version), IP address, and log data for analytics and security purposes.
privacy.section3.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
privacy.section3.body1: To provide and improve app features, including AI-based crop diagnosis and weather alerts.
privacy.section3.body2: To personalize your experience and deliver relevant content in your preferred language.
privacy.section3.body3: To communicate with you about updates, support, and important notices.
privacy.section3.body4: To analyze usage trends and enhance app security.
privacy.section4.title: 4. Data Sharing & Disclosure
privacy.section4.body: We do not sell your personal information. We may share data with trusted partners (e.g., weather APIs, analytics providers) only as necessary to deliver app services. All third-party partners are required to maintain data confidentiality and security.
privacy.section5.title: 5. Data Security
privacy.section5.body: We use industry-standard security measures, including SSL encryption and restricted access, to protect your data. However, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure.
privacy.section6.title: 6. Your Rights & Choices
privacy.section6.subSection1.title: 6.1. Access & Update
privacy.section6.subSection1.body: You can view and update your profile information at any time in the app settings.
privacy.section6.subSection2.title: 6.2. Withdraw Consent & Delete Account
privacy.section6.subSection2.body: You may withdraw consent or request account deletion by contacting our support team. Upon deletion, your personal data will be removed from our systems, except as required by law.
privacy.section7.title: 7. Children's Privacy
privacy.section7.body: Farmacy is not intended for children under 13. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe a child has provided us with personal data, please contact us for removal.
privacy.section8.title: 8. Changes to This Policy
privacy.section8.body: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Material changes will be communicated via in-app notification or message. Continued use of the app after changes constitutes acceptance of the revised policy.
privacy.footer.contact: For questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact our support team through the app.
